question:
A bank's risk measurement tools should be able to capture the exposure from embedded options. Which three products contain embedded options? (Choose Three)
A. Structured Notes
B. US Treasury Bonds
C. Overnight FFS
D. MBSs
E. MMDAs -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
A Board policy that established extremely low tolerances for IRR is likely to affect the bank in what way?
A. Increases the bank's Basis Risk
B. Reduces the Bank's dependence on core deposits
C. Reduces the bank's ability to generate high returns
D. Increases the bank's return volatility -
answer: C. Reduces the bank's ability to generate high returns

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
Interest rate risk related reports reviewed by senior management and the Board, or committee thereof, should include which three of the following? (Choose three.)
A. the amount of interest rate risk taken
B. compliance with established risk limits
C. management's strategies relative to wholesale funding dependency
D. appropriateness of management's strategies in light of the Board's risk tolerance -
answer: A. the amount of interest rate risk taken

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
B. compliance with established risk limits
D. appropriateness of management's strategies in light of the Board's risk tolerance
Which three reports are used to monitor and manage IRR?
A. Gap Report
B. Budget Variance Report
C. Duration Analysis Report
D. Simulation Model Report
E. Contingency Funding Report -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
C. Duration Analysis Report
D. Simulation Model Report
Effective Board and senior management oversight of the bank's IRR activities is the cornerstone of an effective RM process. What is the responsibility of the BOD?
A. Establish effective ICs
B. Develop and implement P&P.
C. Establish and guide the bank's direction and tolerance
D. Oversee the implementation and maintenance of MIS -
answer: C. Establish and guide the bank's direction and tolerance

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
Which two are common measurements of current and potential funding levels? (Choose two)
A. Net loans/time deposits
B. Total assets/total equity capital
C. Net ST Liabs/assets
D. Total equity capital/total deposits
E. ST assets/ST Liabs -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
E. ST assets/ST Liabs
ABC National Bank reported a net interest margin of 4.00% during one year, and a net interest margin of 5.25% during the subsequent year. Market interest rates experienced significant increases during the second year. What would explain the change in the bank's net interest margin?
A. The bank's deposits are primarily non-interest bearing.
B. The bank's loans are primarily fixed-rate and long-term.
C. The bank's investments are primarily callable agency bonds.
D. The bank's overhead expenses decreased during the second year. -
answer: A. The bank's deposits are primarily non-interest bearing.

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
What is the Economic Value of Equity used to measure?
A. equity risk
B. liquidity risk
C. trading account risk
D. long-term earnings exposure
E. short-term earnings exposure -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
What are three funding sources included on a Rollover Risk report? (Choose three.)
A. FHLB Advances
B. Savings Accounts
C. Fed Funds Purchased
D. Certificates of Deposit
E. Money Market Deposit Accounts -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
D. Certificates of Deposit
E. Money Market Deposit Accounts
What are three attributes of a "marketable" security?
A. Is registered under the Securities Act of 1933
B. Is bank stock or a Trust Preferred security of a bank
C. Can be purchased at a negotiated price without sustaining a loss
D. Can be sold with reasonable promptness at a price that corresponds reasonably to its fair value
E. Is offered and sold pursuant to Securities and Exchange Commission Rule 144A and rated investment grade or the credit equivalent -
answer: A. Is registered under the Securities Act of 1933

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
D. Can be sold with reasonable promptness at a price that corresponds reasonably to its fair value
E. Is offered and sold pursuant to Securities and Exchange Commission and rated investment grade or the credit equivalent
11) What would cause a bank's net interest margin to decline?
A. asset sensitive and rates are rising
B. liability sensitive and rates are rising
C. asset sensitive and rates are steady
D. liability sensitive and rates are declining
E. assets and liabilities are matched and rates are steady -
answer: B. Liability sensitive and rates are rising.

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
ABC National Bank provides servicing for over $4 billion in mortgage loans. The value of the mortgage servicing asset (MSA) is roughly $78 million. In order to hedge fluctuations in the value of the MSA, the bank has purchased futures and options on the 10-year Treasury. Which element of interest rate risk is inherent in this scenario and may contribute to the net ineffectiveness of the hedge?
A. Basis Risk
B. Options Risk
C. Repricing Risk
D. Yield Curve Risk -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
ABC National Bank reports a significant volume of structured FHLB advances on its quarterly call report. These liabilities are a source of which element of interest rate risk?
A. Basis Risk
B. Options Risk
C. Repricing Risk
D. Yield Curve Risk -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
Which represents a use of bank funds?
A. acquiring deposits
B. increasing the ALLL
C. issuing additional capital
D. increasing investment securities
E. reducing commercial loan balances -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
Which two benchmarks are used to measure liquidity risk? (Choose Two.)
A. fixed assets to total assets
B. average yield on loan portfolio
C. non-core funding dependence
D. short-term liabilities to total assets
E. nonmaturity deposits to long-term assets -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
D. short-term liabilities to total assets
Which describes a bank that exhibits low liquidity risk?
A. The bank relies heavily on short-term funding sources.
B. The bank's loan to deposit ratio is above its national peer group.
C. The bank's cost of funds is low compared to its local peer group.
D. Loan growth is projected to exceed deposit growth over the next year.
E. A majority of the bank's deposits are certificates of deposit over $100,000. -
answer: C. The bank's cost of funds is low compared to its local peer group.

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
Liquidity is obtained from what source?
A. gap report
B. balance sheet
C. loan trial balance
D. income statement -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
What is included in money market assets?
A. municipal securities
B. acceptances and other assets
C. fed funds sold with overnight maturity or term maturity within 30 days
D. fed funds purchased with an overnight maturity or term maturity within 30 days -
answer: C. fed funds sold with overnight maturity or term maturity within 30 days

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
The investment portfolio can provide liquidity in which three ways? (Choose three.)
A. the maturity of a security
B. the sale of securities for cash
C. as a reverse repurchase agreement
D. as collateral in a repurchase agreement -
answer: A. the maturity of a security

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
B. the sale of securities for cash
D. as collateral in a repurchase agreement
Retail funding consists of what types of deposits?
A. those that a bank receives through third parties
B. those that a bank receives from governmental units
C. those that a bank receives from other financial institutions
D. those that a bank receives from consumers and small businesses -
answer: D. those that a bank receives from consumers and small businesses

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
Which three are considered collateralized wholesale funds? (Choose three.)
A. public funds
B. brokered deposits
C. federal reserve advances
D. treasury tax and loan accounts -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
C. federal reserve advances
D. treasury tax and loan accounts
When assessing liquidity risk management, which three reflect prudent oversight and internal controls? (Choose three.)
A. reporting to the board annually
B. validating systems periodically
C. verifying that duties are properly segregated
D. monitoring compliance with established limits -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
C. verifying that duties are properly segregated
D. monitoring compliance with established limits
Which two are considered when determining the adequacy of liquidity and the quantity of liquidity risk? (Choose two.)
A. the quality of the investment portfolio
B. the volatility of the net interest margin
C. the liquidity policy and established risk limits
D. the bank's ability to meet anticipated funding needs
E. the level and impact of basis risk and yield curve risk -
answer: A. the quality of the investment portfolio

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
D. the bank's ability to meet anticipated funding needs
Which two strategies can banks employ to reduce funding and liquidity risks? (Choose two.)
A. Reduce assets that require term funding, such as loans.
B. Increase assets that require term funding, such as loans.
C. Replace credit insensitive funding with credit sensitive liabilities.
D. Replace credit sensitive liabilities with credit insensitive funding. -
answer: A. Reduce assets that require term funding, such as loans.

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
D. Replace credit sensitive liabilities with credit insensitive funding.
A bank's liquidity forecast for the next 90 days shows the following projections:
Uses of cash
Loan growth $2,400,000
Dividend payment $ 600,000
OCC supervisory fee $ 23,000
Sources of cash
Maturing investment securities $1,500,000
Loan principal amortization $ 245,000
Additional core deposits $ 700,000
Reduction in cash account $ 578,000
Which two describe the effects of these transactions on the bank's financial condition and performance? (Choose two.)
A. the loan to deposit ratio will increase
B. the return on asset ratio will decline
C. the bank's total assets will increase
D. the bank's core deposit to total assets ratio will decline -
answer: A. the loan to deposit ratio will increase

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
C. the bank's total assets will increase
Which three are addressed by a contingency funding plan? (Choose three.)
A. effects on net income
B. asset and liability strategies
C. all of the bank's funding and liquidity needs
D. the bank's funding preferences
E. loan administrative policies and procedures -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
C. all of the bank's funding and liquidity needs
D. the bank's funding preferences
What change in the balance sheet represents a source of funds?
A. decrease in other assets and investments
B. increase in interest-bearing bank balances
C. increase in real estate loans and increase in OREO
D. decrease in time deposits and other savings deposits -
answer: A. decrease in other assets and investments

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
Which three of the following are reviewed when identifying volume and trends in funding? (Choose three.)
A. funding concentrations
B. wholesale funding that may be credit sensitive
C. projected funding needs vs. available sources
D. reasonableness of established policy limits/guidelines
E. impact of funding changes on planning and budgeting processes -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
B. wholesale funding that may be credit sensitive
C. projected funding needs vs. available sources
What are three elements that should be included in a bank's contingency funding plan? (Choose three.) A. detailed action plans
B. early warning triggers
C. deposit pricing surveys
D. earnings-at-risk (EAR) reports
E. definitions of a crisis (or crises) -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
B. early warning triggers
E. definitions of a crisis (or crises)
Which two administrative actions are legally enforceable? (Choose two.)
A. Consent Order
B. Formal Agreement
C. Cease and Desist Order
D. Memorandum of Understanding
E. Matters Requiring Board Attention -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
C. Cease and Desist Order

Total RBC 7.78%
Under Part 6-Prompt Corrective Action (PCA), what is the bank's capital category? -

A. present value

A. Z-tranche
B. companion tranche
C. planned amortization class (PAC) tranche
D. targeted amortization class (TAC) tranche -

question:
Which activity increases bank assets?
A. acquiring deposits
B. liquidating investments
C. increasing treasury stock
D. selling Other Real Estate Owned
E. increasing the Allowance for Loan and Lease Losses -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
Which three loans are required to be on nonaccrual? (Choose three.)
A. A residential real estate loan is 95 days past due, but the borrower has been making timely monthly payments for five months.
B. A commercial loan with a loan-to-value of 50% is past due 119 days. The borrower has just filed for chapter 11 bankruptcy protection and repayment is uncertain.
C. An unsecured commercial loan is 87 days past due and the bank anticipates payment from an insurance settlement within 30 days.
D. A commercial loan is 85 days past due. Collateral is sufficient to cover the loan's principal balance, but the bank expects to charge-off $3,000 in interest and $400 in accrued late charges.
E. A$20,0000 single-payment commercial note secured by machinery and equipment has renewed annually for the last ten years with no principal reduction. The loan is current, but the entire credit relationship is rated substandard. -
answer: B. A commercial loan with a loan-to-value of 50% is past due 119 days. The borrower has just filed for chapter 11 bankruptcy protection and repayment is uncertain.

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
D. A commercial loan is 85 days past due. Collateral is sufficient to cover the loan's principal balance, but the bank expects to charge-off $3,000 in interest and $400 in accrued late charges.
E. A$20,0000 single-payment commercial note secured by machinery and equipment has renewed annually for the last ten years with no principal reduction. The loan is current, but the entire credit relationship is rated substandard.
The 2006 Interagency policy Statement on the Allowance for Loan and Lease Losses (ALLL) requires national banks to analyze the collectibility of its loans and maintain an ALLL at a level that is appropriate and determined in accordance with GAAP. Which two statements are true? (Choose two.)
A. Amounts designated as "unallocated" may be included in the ALLL.
B. If aloan is not impaired under FAS 114, that loan should generally be included in the assessment of the ALLL under FAS 5.
C. If a loan is determined to be impaired under FAS 114, but the amount of the impairment is zero, that loan should be included in the assessment of the ALLL under FAS 5.
D. If a bank has had very low or zero historical losses, it may rely on the industry average loss experience of 50 percent for doubtful loans and 15 percent for substandard loans in determining the ALLL.
E. For purposes of estimating FAS 5 portions of the ALLL, historical -
answer: A. Amounts designated as "unallocated" may be included in the ALLL.

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
B. If aloan is not impaired under FAS 114, that loan should generally be included in the assessment of the ALLL under FAS 5.
According to the Internet Banking examination handbook, which three activities are considered "transactional" when conducted online through a bank's website? (Choose three.)
A. accessing an account
B. initiating a bill payment
C. sending a wire transfer
D. viewing the privacy policy
E. checking posted deposit rates -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
B. initiating a bill payment
C. sending a wire transfer
Which two areas must be reviewed during each community bank supervisory examination cycle regardless of the bank's consumer compliance rating? (Choose two.)
A. Bank Secrecy Act
B. Truth in Lending Act
C. Flood Disaster Protection Act
D. Home Mortgage Disclosure Act
E. Privacy of Consumer Financial Information -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
C. Flood Disaster Protection Act
What is the maximum amount of interest a national bank may charge on loans?
A. A national bank may not charge more than 18%.
B. There is no maximum amount of interest a national bank may charge.
C. A national bank may charge the maximum rate of interest permitted by state law.
D. A national bank may only charge 1% more than the discount rate on 90-day commercial paper. -
answer: C. A national bank may charge the maximum rate of interest permitted by state law.

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
What is the OCC's definition of asset management?
A. the business of providing financial products or services to a third party for a fee or commission
B. the business of providing financial products or services to customers for the purpose of generating profits
C. the business of providing financial products or services to wealthy clients for the purpose of preserving wealth
D. the business of providing financial products or services to a third party for a fee or commission for the purpose of preserving wealth
E. the business of providing financial products or services for the purposes of generating non interest income and retaining existing customers -
answer: A. the business of providing financial products or services to a third party for a fee or commission

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
What are three traditional fiduciary services offered by a community bank trust department? (Choose three.)
A. retail brokerage services
B. registrar and transfer agent
C. investment management services
D. personal trust, including estate administration
E. corporate trust administration, including retirement plan services -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
D. personal trust, including estate administration
E. corporate trust administration, including retirement plan services

A. equity risk
B. liquidity risk
C. trading account risk
D. long-term earnings exposure
E. short-term earnings exposure -

A. gap report
B. balance sheet

question:
Which three are addressed by a contingency funding plan? (Choose three.)
A. effects on net income
B. asset and liability strategies
C. all of the bank's funding and liquidity needs
D. the bank's funding preferences
E. loan administration policies and procedures -

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
C. all of the bank's funding and liquidity needs
D. the bank's funding preferences
According to 12 CFR 7 Subpart A - Bank Powers, which of the following three activities are permissible? (Choose three.)
A. A national bank may establish and operate a messenger service.
B. A national bank may invest in a locally owned casino if it is providing jobs for its community.
C. A national bank may maintain and operate a facility that sells lottery tickets on bank premises.
D. A national bank may assist its customers in preparing their tax returns, either gratuitously or for a fee.
E. A national bank may maintain and operate a postal substation on banking premises and receive income from it. -
answer: A. A national bank may establish and operate a messenger service.

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
D. A national bank may assist its customers in preparing their tax returns, either gratuitously or for a fee.
E. A national bank may maintain and operate a postal substation on banking premises and receive income from it.
Bank management is responsible for the implementation, integrity, and maintenance of risk management systems. Which two must management perform? (Choose two.)
A. keep the directors adequately informed
B. ensure policies are written
C. annually assess the loan portfolio's risk
D. develop policies that define the institution's risk tolerance
E. provide a written report on staffing adequacy each year -
answer: A. keep the directors adequately informed

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
D. develop policies that define the institution's risk tolerance
What is reflective of an asset quality rating of "2"?
A. Asset quality or credit administration practices are less than satisfactory.
B. The levels of risk and problem assets are significant and inadequately controlled.
C. The level and severity of classifications and other weaknesses warrant a limited level of supervisory attention.
D. Identified weaknesses are minor in nature and risk exposure is modest in relation to capital protection and management's abilities. -
answer: C. The level and severity of classifications and other weaknesses warrant a limited level of supervisory attention.

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
Which statement is true regarding the board's responsibility to monitor bank operations? A. The board should ensure that it fulfills the monitoring requirements set by management. B. The board may delegate responsibility for monitoring the bank's operations to competent management.
C. The board should ensure that management understands and carries out board policies and directives.
D. The board should develop and approve daily operating procedures and policies and delegate responsibility to management to ensure implementation. -
answer: C. The board should ensure that management understands and carries out board policies and directives.

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
Which three supervisory actions can the OCC subject a bank to that is undercapitalized per Prompt Corrective Action (PCA) regulations? (Choose three.)
A. restrict the growth of the bank's assets
B. require the submission of a capital restoration plan
C. restrict payments on the bank's subordinated debt
D. restrict payments of capital distributions and management fees -
answer: A. restrict the growth of the bank's assets

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
B. require the submission of a capital restoration plan
D. restrict payments of capital distributions and management fees
From a review of the UBPR, which statement is true about banks that elect Subchapter S status for income taxes?
A. A flat 28% rate is applied to cash dividends.
B. The UBPR adjusts after tax earnings and dividends used in the ratios.
C. Dollar data displayed in the UBPR is adjusted for Subchapter S status.
D. The UBPR does not adjust after tax earnings and dividends used in the ratios. -
answer: B. The UBPR adjusts after tax earnings and dividends used in the ratios.

source.title: OCC UCE MC Exam Questions & Answers 2024/2025

question:
Documentation on all loans to executive officers must include a call provision.
A. True
B. False -

answer: A. Technical competence, leadership, and administrative ability

B. Demonstrated willingness to serve the legitimate banking needs of the community

A. True
